title: Detect if any media is being played
author: t2_12fajr
text:
Hi! 

Are there any ways that you know of to detect if any media is being played by the OS? Ideally cross platform, but OS specific works. Primarily interested in Windows with secondary for Linux.

Also separate for Audio and Video would be good.

The context is that I'm trying to make a script that will be able to reliably tell if PC is idle or not, and playing video should be considered as not idle. Music I'm not sure yet, so optional. I curently use  

win32api.GetLastInputInfo() which is great, but does not work when you are watching a video or something.

​

Also cant just check if a process is running, because of so many players and stuff like youtube, netflix and lots of other ways that a video can be played.

comments.author: sme272
comments.body: You could look into the [Windows Audio Session API](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/coreaudio/wasapi) and see if you can find a way to detect all active audio streams.
